verses.verse: Now the Lord<WH3068> said<WH559> to Moses<WH4872> and Aaron<WH175> in the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714>
"This<WH2088> month<WH2320> shall be the beginning<WH7218> of months<WH2320> for you; it is to be the first<WH7223> month<WH2320> of the year<WH8141> to you.

"Speak<WH1696> to all<WH3605> the congregation<WH5712> of Israel,<WH3478> saying,<WH559> 'On the tenth<WH6218> of this<WH2088> month<WH2320> they are each<WH376> one<WH376> to take<WH3947> a lamb<WH7716> for themselves, according to their fathers' households,<WH1004> a lamb<WH7716> for each household.<WH1004>

'Now if<WH518> the household<WH1004> is too<WH4480> small<WH4591> for a lamb,<WH7716> then he and his neighbor<WH7934> nearest<WH7138> to his house<WH1004> are to take<WH3947> one according to the number<WH4373> of persons<WH5315> [in them;] according<WH6310> to what each<WH376> man<WH376> should eat,<WH398> you are to divide<WH3699> the lamb.<WH7716>
'Your lamb<WH7716> shall be an unblemished<WH8549> male<WH2145> a year<WH8141> old;<WH1121> you may take<WH3947> it from the sheep<WH3532> or from the goats.<WH5795>

'And you shall keep<WH1961> <WH4931> it until<WH5704> the fourteenth<WH702> <WH6240> day<WH3117> of the same<WH2088> month,<WH2320> then the whole<WH3605> assembly<WH6951> of the congregation<WH5712> of Israel<WH3478> is to kill<WH7819> it at twilight.<WH6153>

'Moreover, they shall take<WH3947> some<WH4480> of the blood<WH1818> and put<WH5414> it on the two<WH8147> doorposts<WH4201> and on the lintel<WH4947> of the houses<WH1004> in which<WH834> they eat<WH398> it.

'And they shall eat<WH398> the flesh<WH1320> that [same] night,<WH3915> roasted<WH6748> with fire,<WH784> and they shall eat<WH398> it with unleavened<WH4682> bread<WH4682> and bitter<WH4844> herbs.<WH4844>

'Do not eat<WH398> any<WH4480> of it raw<WH4995> or boiled<WH1310> at all<WH1310> with water,<WH4325> but rather<WH3588> <WH518> roasted<WH6748> with fire,<WH784> [both] its head<WH7218> and its legs<WH3767> along<WH5921> with its entrails.<WH7130>

'And you shall not leave<WH3498> any<WH4480> of it over<WH3498> until<WH5704> morning,<WH1242> but whatever is left<WH3498> of it until<WH5704> morning,<WH1242> you shall burn<WH8313> with fire.<WH784>

'Now you shall eat<WH398> it in this<WH3602> manner:<WH3602> [with] your loins<WH4975> girded,<WH2296> your sandals<WH5275> on your feet,<WH7272> and your staff<WH4731> in your hand;<WH3027> and you shall eat<WH398> it in haste<WH2649> – it is the Lord's Passover.<WH6453>

'For I will go<WH5674> through<WH5674> the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> on that night,<WH3915> and will strike<WH5221> down<WH5221> all<WH3605> the first-born in the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> both<WH4480> man<WH120> and beast;<WH929> and against all<WH3605> the gods<WH430> of Egypt<WH4714> I will execute<WH6213> judgments<WH8201> – I am the Lord.<WH3068>

'And the blood<WH1818> shall be a sign<WH226> for you on the houses<WH1004> where<WH834> <WH8033> you live; and when I see<WH7200> the blood<WH1818> I will pass<WH6452> over<WH5921> you, and no<WH3808> plague<WH5063> will befall<WH1961> you to destroy<WH7843> [you] when I strike<WH5221> the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>

'Now this<WH2088> day<WH3117> will be a memorial<WH2146> to you, and you shall celebrate<WH2287> it [as] a feast<WH2282> to the Lord;<WH3068> throughout your generations<WH1755> you are to celebrate<WH2287> it [as] a permanent<WH5769> ordinance.<WH2708>

'Seven<WH7651> days<WH3117> you shall eat<WH398> unleavened<WH4682> bread,<WH4682> but on the first<WH7223> day<WH3117> you shall remove<WH7673> leaven<WH7603> from your houses;<WH1004> for whoever<WH3605> eats<WH398> anything leavened<WH2557> from the first<WH7223> day<WH3117> until<WH5704> the seventh<WH7637> day,<WH3117> that person<WH5315> shall be cut<WH3772> off<WH3772> from Israel.<WH3478>

'And on the first<WH7223> day<WH3117> you shall have a holy<WH6944> assembly,<WH4744> and [another] holy<WH6944> assembly<WH4744> on the seventh<WH7637> day;<WH3117> no<WH3808> work<WH4399> at all<WH3605> shall be done<WH6213> on them, except<WH389> what<WH834> must be eaten<WH398> by every<WH3605> person,<WH5315> that alone<WH905> may be prepared<WH6213> by you.

'You shall also observe<WH8104> the [Feast of] Unleavened<WH4682> Bread,<WH4682> for on this<WH2088> very<WH6106> day<WH3117> I brought<WH3318> your hosts<WH6635> out of the land<WH776> of Egypt;<WH4714> therefore you shall observe<WH8104> this<WH2088> day<WH3117> throughout your generations<WH1755> as a permanent<WH5769> ordinance.<WH2708>

'In the first<WH7223> [month,<WH2320>] on the fourteenth<WH702> <WH6240> day<WH3117> of the month<WH2320> at evening,<WH6153> you shall eat<WH398> unleavened<WH4682> bread,<WH4682> until<WH5704> the twenty-first day<WH3117> of the month at evening.<WH6153>

'Seven<WH7651> days<WH3117> there shall be no<WH3808> leaven<WH7603> found<WH4672> in your houses;<WH1004> for whoever<WH3605> eats<WH398> what<WH9260> is leavened,<WH9260> that person<WH5315> shall be cut<WH3772> off<WH3772> from the congregation<WH5712> of Israel,<WH3478> whether [he is] an alien<WH1616> or a native<WH249> of the land.<WH776>
'You shall not eat<WH398> anything<WH3605> leavened;<WH9260> in all<WH3605> your dwellings<WH4186> you shall eat<WH398> unleavened<WH4682> bread.<WH4682>' "

Then Moses<WH4872> called<WH7121> for all<WH3605> the elders<WH2205> of Israel,<WH3478> and said<WH559> to them, "Go<WH4900> and take<WH3947> for yourselves lambs<WH6629> according to your families,<WH4940> and slay<WH7819> the Passover<WH6453> [lamb.]

"And you shall take<WH3947> a bunch<WH92> of hyssop<WH231> and dip<WH2881> it in the blood<WH1818> which<WH834> is in the basin,<WH9371> and apply<WH5060> some<WH4480> of the blood<WH1818> that is in the basin<WH9371> to the lintel<WH4947> and the two<WH8147> doorposts;<WH4201> and none<WH3808> <WH376> of you shall go<WH3318> outside<WH3318> the door<WH6607> of his house<WH1004> until<WH5704> morning.<WH1242>

"For the Lord<WH3068> will pass<WH5674> through<WH5674> to smite<WH5062> the Egyptians;<WH4714> and when He sees<WH7200> the blood<WH1818> on the lintel<WH4947> and on the two<WH8147> doorposts,<WH4201> the Lord<WH3068> will pass<WH6452> over<WH5921> the door<WH6607> and will not allow<WH5414> the destroyer<WH7843> to come<WH935> in to your houses<WH1004> to smite<WH5062> [you.]
"And you shall observe<WH8104> this<WH2088> event<WH1697> as an ordinance<WH2706> for you and your children<WH1121> forever.<WH5704> <WH5769>

"And it will come<WH1961> about when<WH3588> you enter<WH935> the land<WH776> which<WH834> the Lord<WH3068> will give<WH5414> you, as He has promised,<WH1696> that you shall observe<WH8104> this<WH2088> rite.<WH5656>
"And it will come<WH1961> about when your children<WH1121> will say<WH559> to you, 'What<WH4100> does this<WH2088> rite<WH5656> mean to you?'

that you shall say,<WH559> 'It is a Passover<WH6453> sacrifice<WH2077> to the Lord<WH3068> who<WH834> passed<WH6452> over<WH5921> the houses<WH1004> of the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> in Egypt<WH4714> when He smote<WH5062> the Egyptians,<WH4714> but spared<WH5337> our homes.<WH1004>' "And the people<WH5971> bowed<WH6915> low<WH6915> and worshiped.<WH7812>
Then the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> went<WH1980> and did<WH6213> [so;<WH3651>] just<WH9201> as the Lord<WH3068> had commanded<WH6680> Moses<WH4872> and Aaron,<WH175> so they did.<WH6213>

Now it came<WH1961> about at midnight<WH2677> <WH3915> that the Lord<WH3068> struck<WH5221> all<WH3605> the first-born in the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> from the first-born of Pharaoh<WH6547> who sat<WH3427> on his throne<WH3678> to the first-born of the captive<WH7628> who<WH834> was in the dungeon,<WH1004> <WH953> and all<WH3605> the first-born of cattle.<WH929>

And Pharaoh<WH6547> arose<WH6965> in the night,<WH3915> he and all<WH3605> his servants<WH5650> and all<WH3605> the Egyptians;<WH4714> and there was a great<WH1419> cry<WH6818> in Egypt,<WH4714> for there<WH369> was no<WH369> home<WH1004> where<WH834> <WH8033> there<WH369> was not someone dead.<WH4191>

Then he called<WH7121> for Moses<WH4872> and Aaron<WH175> at night<WH3915> and said,<WH559> "Rise<WH6965> up, get<WH3318> out from among<WH8432> my people,<WH5971> both<WH1571> you and the sons<WH1121> of Israel;<WH3478> and go,<WH1980> worship<WH5647> the Lord,<WH3068> as you have said.<WH1696>
"Take<WH3947> both<WH1571> your flocks<WH6629> and your herds,<WH1241> as you have said,<WH1696> and go,<WH1980> and bless<WH1288> me also.<WH1571>"
And the Egyptians<WH4714> urged<WH2388> <WH5921> the people,<WH5971> to send<WH7971> them out of the land<WH776> in haste,<WH4116> for they said,<WH559> "We shall all<WH3605> be dead.<WH4191>"

So the people<WH5971> took<WH5375> their dough<WH1217> before<WH2962> it was leavened,<WH2556> [with] their kneading<WH4863> bowls<WH4863> bound<WH9503> up in the clothes<WH8071> on their shoulders.<WH7926>

Now the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> had done<WH6213> according to the word<WH1697> of Moses,<WH4872> for they had requested<WH7592> from the Egyptians<WH4714> articles<WH3627> of silver<WH3701> and articles<WH3627> of gold,<WH2091> and clothing;<WH8071>

and the Lord<WH3068> had given<WH5414> the people<WH5971> favor<WH2580> in the sight<WH5869> of the Egyptians,<WH4714> so that they let them have their request.<WH7592> Thus they plundered<WH5337> the Egyptians.<WH4714>

Now the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> journeyed<WH5265> from Rameses<WH7486> to Succoth,<WH5523> about six<WH8337> hundred<WH3967> thousand<WH505> men<WH1397> on foot,<WH7273> aside<WH905> from children.<WH2945>
And a mixed<WH9434> multitude<WH7227> also<WH1571> went<WH5927> up with them, along with flocks<WH6629> and herds,<WH1241> a very<WH3966> large<WH3515> number<WH3515> of livestock.<WH4735>

And they baked<WH644> the dough<WH1217> which<WH834> they had brought<WH3318> out of Egypt<WH4714> into cakes<WH5692> of unleavened<WH4682> bread.<WH4682> For it had not become<WH2556> leavened,<WH2556> since<WH3588> they were driven<WH1644> out of Egypt<WH4714> and could<WH3201> not delay,<WH4102> nor<WH1571> <WH3808> had they prepared<WH6213> any<WH1571> provisions<WH6720> for themselves.

And it came<WH1961> about at the end<WH7093> of four<WH702> hundred<WH3967> and thirty<WH7970> years,<WH8141> to the very<WH6106> day,<WH3117> that all<WH3605> the hosts<WH6635> of the Lord<WH3068> went<WH3318> out from the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>

And the Lord<WH3068> said<WH559> to Moses<WH4872> and Aaron,<WH175> "This<WH2088> is the ordinance<WH2708> of the Passover:<WH6453> no<WH3605> <WH3808> foreigner<WH1121> <WH5236> is to eat<WH398> of it;
but every<WH3605> man's slave<WH5650> purchased<WH4736> with money,<WH3701> after you have circumcised<WH4135> him, then<WH227> he may eat<WH398> of it.

Then all<WH3605> the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> did<WH6213> [so;] they did<WH6213> just<WH9201> as the Lord<WH3068> had commanded<WH6680> Moses<WH4872> and Aaron.<WH175>
